chargeHist.descr: Theft from a Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kecia J. Fait was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*First 75 days in jail, the second 75 days on GPS electronic home monitor if approved by risk assessment and jail administration
*Eligible for huber priviliges for work and any counseling she may be involved in

miscConds.notes: *Pay restitution to Central City Credit Union, joint and several with co-defendant - Dennis Fait

*Pay costs
*Pay DNA surcharge

*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*No contact with the victim's in this case, Central City Credit Union and Bhadresh Mehta

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular
Plea Hearing set for January 16, 2018 at 11:00 a.m. - insufficient address

Defendant Kecia J. Fait in court with attorney William George Weiland. Defendant Kecia J. Fait in custody. Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:03 a.m.  Case is called and appearances are stated.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Amended Information had been e-filed on 01/16/18.
Atty Weiland waives reading of the amended information.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

State has complied with victim notification; DA's Office had contacted both victim's but neither victim appears in Court today and State has provided written statements from the victim's to the Court.

Atty Zell makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Weiland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 150 day jail sentence 
First 75 days in jail, the second 75 days on GPS electronic home monitor if approved by risk assessment and jail administration
Eligible for huber priviliges for work and any counseling she may be involved in
27 days of jail credit if probation is revoked
Placed on Probation for 24 months - 
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,500 joint/several liability to the Central City Credit Union
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
No contact with the  victim's in this case, Central City Credit Union and Bhadresh Mehta 
27 days of jail 
27 days of jail credit 
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay 150 day jail sentence 
First 75 days in jail, the second 75 days on GPS electronic home monitor if approved by risk assessment and jail administration
Eligible for huber priviliges for work and any counseling she may be involved in
27 days of jail credit if probation is revoked
Placed on Probation for 24 months - 
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs 
Pay DNA Surcharge

20 days to appeal
Plea hearing on January 16, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Atty William Weiland appointed
